result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarina Marie Stone

defendant.name: Stone, Sarina Marie
defendant.address: 10892 S Cty Tk A, Solon Springs, WI 54873

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
Exhibit #1 - Appraisal Receipt
Exhibit #2 - Picture of coins
Exhibit #3 - Up close picture of coins

10:03 AM Defendant Sarina Marie Stone in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Sarina Marie Stone.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Austin Lauridsen, sworn and testifies. Did traffic stop, 3 people in vehicle. 1 person got out and went into smoke shop (defendant). Witness identifies defendant. Searched vehicle, found drug paraph. and collector coins. Exhibit #1 Receipt from pawn shop. Exhibit #2 All coins photo. Exhibit #3 Closeup of coin photo. 
Court receives exhibits
Witness- researched coins. Low end value is $1850 per gold coin. Found address where coins were found, contacted property owner in Florida.  He stated no one had permission to go there or take property
Att Hoffman cross examines. Coins were spread throughout vehicle. Polaski was person who sold the coins. Property owner didn't specifically identify coins
State calls Matthew Izzard- sworn and testifies. Spoke to defendant , she said she unburied coins from under a mattress. Went to property and found mattress beside garage. Witness identifies defendant. 
Att Hoffman cross examines.
State rests
Defense rests
State requests bind over
Att Hoffman opposes bind over
Court finds probable cause, defendant is bound over for arraignment. Sets date
Arraignment scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
11:28 AM Defendant Sarina Marie Stone in court.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant in regards to obtaining counsel. Defendant thought she had counsel appointed. Defendant did not follow up with Public Defender's Office to obtain counsel. Defendant would like to reschedule preliminary hearing. Court reviews with defendant options of obtaining counsel. Court resets preliminary hearing. Court instructs defendant to go to public defender's office. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:45 am.
No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No contact with JM or 9428 E Cty Tk A, Solon Springs WI.

1:38pm Court recalls case; defendant now appears. 
Defendant Sarina Stone in court with Attorney Michael Hoffman via video.  Attorney Allison Cogbill appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Attorney requests preliminary hearing. 
Court quashes warrant; questions defendant on late appearance. 
Defendant indicates that her jeep needs a fuel filter and it's not running right so it was slowing her down.
State requests $1000cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No contact with JM or 9428 E Cty Tk A, Solon Springs WI.
Request is based on the fact that she has 4 open cases for meth; all with cash bonds. Did not charge the bail jumpings as part of this case but that may happen in the future.
Attorney Hoffman indicates lifelong resident of douglas county, family ties, delivers for food dudes, self employed cleaning business. Referenced late appearance in a case but has made all other appearances in that file.  Allegation from back in May.  Has substantial amount of cash bail posted on other cases; consequences would result in a fairly significant loss is she fails to appear. Does not have any significant amount of money to post today.
Defendant indicates that she has $50 to her name right now.
Attorney requests significant signature bonds; $5000
Court reviews argument, history, failures to appear- questions defendant again the highest amount she can post.
Defendant indicates she can post $160 and thats all she has, she's moving to duluth.
Court orders $500cb No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No contact with JM or 9428 E Cty Tk A, Solon Springs WI.
Defendant asks for a lower cash bail; Court denies request for lower bail.
Defendant asks court to lower bail to $400; Court denies request.

1:34 PM Defendant Sarina Marie Stone not in court. Attorney Michael Hoffman appears for the defendant.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court questions reason for calling case today.
State indicates defendant was released to appear with today's date and time.
.Attorney Hoffman indicates that client called his office stating that she was going to be late.
Based on RTA'd to today requesting warrant, adjoining states
Court orders warrant with requested geographic restrictions.
